channel.title: Aviary feather. Help please
channel.description: So I found an interesting program, called Aviary. And I currently have the Feather. (Lol) What it does is it's an online photo editor, exactly what I needed for my site. Though, blurring isn't the best. What I'd like done is make it so you can actually upload photo's to it. I assume I still need a photo uploader, and then php/javascript to call the photo to the editor. And this also means I need to set rights to a person via logging in through MySQL and Php. The program can be found at www.aviary.com :) please help if possible.

item.title: Aviary feather. Help please
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:4, topic:454677”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=557540.msg4080529#msg4080529 date=1345326064]

http://www.aviary.com/web-documentation#constructor-example

Everything from there down will help you integrate with the widget.

That doesn’t document how to make it so only a specific person, or user can edit it. Nor how to change what image is added into the editor.
[/quote]

I havn’t actually used this editor. But doesn’t the example I just linked you to show you how to initialize the editor with an image…?

To save an image to the local filesystem for members only, that’s where you write the server-side script.[/quote]
It’s a little more complex. I think you’ve seen my other topic in this discussion about my site, if not take a look
I need to to write the edit only options client only (person logged into their account) and for everyone else have it display only the photo, before or after the changes. I’ve looked at aviary’s sandbox on how it initializes, I believe i just need to get the correct script. Whether i need to write it or what.

Read full topic

item.title: Aviary feather. Help please
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:454677”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=557540.msg4079898#msg4079898 date=1345257047]

Aviary

Aviary

Make photos beautiful in seconds with stunning filters, frames, stickers, touch-up tools and more. Download now – it's free!

Everything from there down will help you integrate with the widget.
[/quote]
That doesn’t document how to make it so only a specific person, or user can edit it. Nor how to change what image is added into the editor.[/quote]

I havn’t actually used this editor. But doesn’t the example I just linked you to show you how to initialize the editor with an image…?

To save an image to the local filesystem for members only, that’s where you write the server-side script.

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So I found an interesting program, called Aviary. And I currently have the Feather. (Lol) What it does is it’s an online photo editor, exactly what I needed for my site. Though, blurring isn’t the best. What I’d like done is make it so you can actually upload photo’s to it. I assume I still need a photo uploader, and then php/javascript to call the photo to the editor. And this also means I need to set rights to a person via logging in through MySQL and Php.
The program can be found at www.aviary.com
please help if possible.
